title: Audio player with voice commands
content: In this tutorial you will learn how to make an audio player that you can pause and play with voice commands.

Select **AudioPlayer** to turn your smartphone into an audio player

![simple lamp](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/Devices/Items/AudioPlayer-Item.png)

Scan the QR code with your smartphone.

![QrCode](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/qrscan.png)

Alternatively, click on _Open in this device_ to open it locally.

Press devices again, select **SpeechRecognition**

![simple lamp](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/Devices/Items/AudioPlayer-Item.png)

Press on your smartphone **Add device via QR code**

![simple lamp](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/Devices/Add-device-via-qr-code.png)

and scan the QR code. Alternatively, click on _Open in this device_ to open it locally.

Press ![input](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/Logic/Logic.png) on the sidebar,

moves the following components to the workspace

the **if** component

![QrCode](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/Logic/if-component.png)

and the **comparison** component

![comparison](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/Logic/comparison-component.png)

Press ![input](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/Text/Text.png) on the sidebar,

move the **text** component to the workspace

![QrCode](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/Text/text-component.png)

Move the following components to the workspace

the **play audio** component

![QrCode](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/audio-player-with-voice-commands/play-audio.png)
the **stop** component

![QrCode](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/audio-player-with-voice-commands/stop-audio.png)

and the **text** component

![QrCode](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/audio-player-with-voice-commands/text.png)

Put the components of the previous steps as in the image

![simple lamp](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/audio-player-with-voice-commands/blocks.png)
The idea is to recognize your voice and evaluate whether what the smartphone recognizes matches any of the commands.

To be listening when you say something we will use events, imagine that a person is listening to you attentively and every time you say something he/she alerts the smartphone.

Move to the workspace the event component

![input](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/audio-player-with-voice-commands/event-SpeechRecognition.png)

and place it as shown in the picture

![QrCode](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/audio-player-with-voice-commands/event.png)
